summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/04/17 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Richard Attenborough'], 'Producers': ['Joseph E. Levine', 'Richard Levine', 'Michael Stanley-Evans'], 'Starring': ['Dirk Bogarde', 'James Caan', 'Michael Caine'], 'Studio': ['MGM']} Review Text: Very well done Hollywood's take on Monty's supposed arogance and, well, his "lack of wisdom" in the Market Garden operation. Special kudos to Gene Hackman for his character of General Sosabowski - one of the greatest (and most forgotten) leaders of allied forces, screwed royally by Brits... Review Title: Great WWII classic Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/05/14 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tim Wolochatiuk'], 'Producers': ['Christopher Gagosz'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Walker', 'Benjamin Muir'], 'Studio': ['Entertainment One']} Review Text: Granted, this is not Spielberg's Ryan, but it does not pretend to it - and this IS a very good movie on Canadian forces invading Juno beach in Normandy, on D-day. Well narrated, realistic and very nicely watchable - I was not at all dissappointed spending $3 for streaming it. A nice bonus is the after-movie interviews with actual veterans whose stories served as base for the screenplay.
A MUST FOR EVERY WWII PASSIONATE. Review Title: Good movie Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/03/16 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Jennifer Yuh Nelson'], 'Producers': ['Melissa Cobb'], 'Starring': ['Jack Black', 'Angelina Jolie', 'Dustin Hoffman'], 'Studio': ['DreamWorks Animation']} Review Text: Classic already it is! Review Title: Cool movie! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/03/16 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jon Favreau'], 'Producers': ['Brian Grazer', 'Ron Howard', 'Alex Kurtzman', 'Roberto Orci', 'Scott Mitchell Rosenberg'], 'Starring': ['Daniel Craig', 'Harrison Ford', 'Olivia Wilde'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']} Review Text: Nice beginning, OK throughout, s***ty Hollywood ending - a classic Hollywood entertainment movie - for people with thinking challenges... Review Title: Ehm... Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/02/01 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Paul Anderson'], 'Producers': ['Lawrence Gordon', 'Larry Gordon', 'Lloyd Levin', 'Jeremy Bolt'], 'Starring': ['Laurence Fishburne', 'Sam Neill', 'Kathleen Quinlan'], 'Studio': ['SciFi and Fantasy']} Review Text: It was the typical sin of Hollywood of the 90's - great beginning and the middle (little worse), then a very shitty ending. This movie, unfortunately, was no different. Fist, the idea is more than brilliant - a thoughtful producer would have taken it to its apex, probably ending up in a cult movie like Blade Runner or Matrix. But, sadly, it happened to be a typical Hollywood producer disease of those days (and there are still some like that today)... which means: the 2/3rd of the movie is given to the director and he makes something so good that it whacks you out of your chair (all of it: directory, screenplay, cinematography, acting, all the ideas) - there is really not much that I would tell be different that the best movies of those days there. However, then we come to the last 1/3rd and you can tell that the producer became more and more ignorant and tired of the narrative (too complicated for a simple soda/pop brain) and then the director/script were pushed into a crappy set of cliches and templates so overabundant in those days. Too stupid, too gory and too simple. Phenomenal movie with very badly made and stupid ending...
Yet, I still recommend to watch it for the superb taste of the first hour of it... Review Title: Potential to be an all-time phenomenon, brilliant Sci-Fi classic, salvaged by a typical stupid/brainless Hollywood ending... Rating: 3.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual's purchase history reveals a strong preference for World War II-themed films, as evidenced by consistently high ratings for related titles. There is a notable sentiment for historical realism and narrative depth, with a tendency to appreciate movies that provide unique perspectives, particularly those featuring veterans' stories. This consumer values quality storytelling and character development, often praising films for their engaging beginnings and criticizing weak endings, reflecting an expectation for coherence and satisfaction throughout. 

In terms of quality preferences, almost all reviews feature high average ratings (4.1 to 5.0), indicating a consistent inclination towards well-produced and critically acclaimed content. While price sensitivity is apparent, particularly in the positive reception of lower-cost streaming options, their enthusiasm for quality storytelling suggests that they are willing to invest in higher-priced content if it meets their standards. Additionally, the critique of common Hollywood clichés points towards a desire for originality and thoughtful filmmaking. Overall, this consumer is drawn to engaging narratives, historical contexts, and films with high production values, while remaining wary of predictable plots and unsatisfying conclusions.

target_interaction.title: It was OKAY at best, I guess...
target_interaction.text: The original Hollywood movie was much better. This series just took that 2 hrs movie and put it under a hydraulic press to squeeze a ~6 hours out of it. Nothing new, rare action moments mixed with quite a lot of boring sequences and a totally out of point adventures of Hanna in the decadent world of UK teenagers. Very timid attempts to show some moral dilemmas, but pretty meager acting on them makes it feel fake. Overall, the balance is 3 hours of adequate TV entertainment vs. three hours of wasted time.
